item.title: The Hard Thing About Hard Things - Ben Horowitz: Book Review
item.description: Horowitz suggests that he used to be too positive and would shield bad news from his employees as he thought he’d make the problem worse by transferring the burden onto them. He came to the realisation that this was counter productive since he often wasn’t the best placed person to fix a problem e.g. if it was a problem with the product then the engineering team needed to know so they could write the code to fix it.
